p: There are 179 cases of newborns tested for SARS-CoV-2 at birth from pregnant women infected in the third trimester of pregnancy described in the literature [ 17, 12, 18, 19, 29, [30], [31], [32], [33], [34], [35], [36], [37]]. All of the patients were infected in late pregnancy and delivered within a few days of infection (mean: 3 days, range: 0 to 25 days). PCRs were performed on amniotic fluid and on cord blood during respectively 37 and 48 of these deliveries, all of which were negative ( Table 1 ).
